member.name: T:indice.Edi.EdiPathComparer
member.summary:
Compares two s based on their logical structure.
The resulting order would be:
ServiceStringAdvice
InterchangeHeader
FunctionalGroupHeader
MessageHeader
CustomSegments
MessageTrailer
FunctionalGroupTrailer
InterchangeTrailer

member.name: T:indice.Edi.EdiReader.State
member.summary: Specifies the state of the reader.

member.name: F:indice.Edi.EdiReader.State.Start
member.summary: The Read method has not been called.

member.name: F:indice.Edi.EdiReader.State.Complete
member.summary: The end of the file has been reached successfully.

member.summary: The Close method has been called.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar
member.summary: The comprises of all the basic structural settings. Essentialy these are the rules for X12, EDIFact or TRADACOMS.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.SegmentNameDelimiter
member.summary: Segment name delimiter is the character used to seperate between a segment name and its elements. Default value '+' same as

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.ComponentDataElementSeparator
member.summary: Component data element separator is the "second level" separator of data elements within a message segment. Default value ':'
member.value: The character used to separate between components

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.DataElementSeparator
member.summary: Data element separator is the "first level" separator of data elements within a message segment. Default value '+'

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.DecimalMark
member.summary: Used in EDI-Fact Only. Otherwize null

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.ReleaseCharacter
member.summary: The release character (analogous to the \ in regular expressions) is used as a prefix to remove special meaning from the separator, segment termination, and release characters when they are used as plain text. Default value is '?'

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.Reserved
member.summary:
These characters are reserved for future use.
eg. or can not be any in this list.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.SegmentTerminator
member.summary: Segment terminator indicates the end of a message segment.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiGrammar.ServiceStringAdviceTag
member.summary: Only available in EDI Fact. Otherwize null

member.name: P:indice.Edi.IEdiLineInfo.LineNumber
member.summary: Gets the current line number.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Picture
member.summary: Indicates the number of numeric (9) digits or alphanumeric (X) characters allowed in the data field. If the field is numeric, this excludes any minus sign or the decimal point. The decimal point is implied and its position within the data field is indicate by V.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Picture.Scale
member.summary: This is the total size of the string in digits

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Picture.Precision
member.summary: In case of floating point number this holds the number of decimal places. Its length.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Picture.Kind
member.summary: indicates the of the value represented. (ie )

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Picture.HasPrecision
member.summary: This indicated if the value is a floating point number with by checking whether is positive.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionStackMode
member.summary: The mode specified how the conditions found on top of properties and fields will be handled. means all conditions must be satisfied versus means atleast one.

member.name: F:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionStackMode.All
member.summary: All conditions must be satisfied.

member.name: F:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionStackMode.Any
member.summary: At least one condition must be satisfied.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiAnyAttribute
member.summary: In case we need to alter the default stacking behavior. By default all stacked conditions must be satisfied for a binding to take place. This attribute changes the behavior to at least one.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiAttribute
member.summary: Base class for s

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionCheckType
member.summary: The mode that a condition is checked against a value. By default the mode is set to check for

member.name: F:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionCheckType.Equal
member.summary: The value should be equal

member.name: F:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionCheckType.NotEqual
member.summary: The value should not be equal.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionBaseAttribute
member.summary: In case multiple MessageTypes or Segment types with the same name. is used to discriminate the classes based on a component value. This class serves as the base implementation. You can subclass this and override the SatisfiedBy method in order to implement a custom condition check.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiConditionAttribute
member.summary: In case multiple MessageTypes or Segment types with the same name. is used to discriminate the classes based on a component value

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiElementAttribute
member.summary: Elements are considered to be groups of values otherwise known as groups of components. One can use this attribute to deserialize into a complex class that resides inside a segment.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiGroupAttribute
member.summary: marks a propery/class to be deserialized for any group found.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiMessageAttribute
member.summary: marks a propery/class to be deserialized for any message found.

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiPathAttribute
member.summary: is used to specify the path. Path is similar to a relative uri. ie DTM/0/1 or DTM/0 or even simply DTM

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiSegmentAttribute
member.summary: marks a propery/class to be deserialized for a given segment. Used in conjunction with EdiPath

member.name: T:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiSegmentGroupAttribute
member.summary: Marks a propery/class as a logical container of segments. This allows a user to decorate a class whith information regarding the starting and ending segments that define a virtual group other than the standard ones (Functional Group etc). Can be applied on Lists the same way that [Message] or [Segment] attributes work. Also known as Segment Loops

member.name: M:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiSegmentGroupAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The segment name that marks the begining of a each group.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiSegmentGroupAttribute.Start
member.summary: The segment name that defines the start of a group.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiSegmentGroupAttribute.SequenceEnd
member.summary: Optionaly define the segment name that defines the end of the group or sequence.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiStructure.IsClosed
member.summary: This is closed and must be removed from stack

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiStructure.IsGroup
member.summary: This checkes to see if this is a custom sequence of segments.

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiStructure.GroupStart

member.name: P:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiStructure.SequenceEnd
member.summary: The sequence start path.

member.name: M:indice.Edi.Serialization.EdiStructure.Close
member.summary: Marks this ready for removal from the stack. Useful on where there is a close condition.
